page.title: 18A DAY IN MY LIFE -2
page.content: Awakened at 6.30 am by radio, had black coffee made by my husband, Tim. I got up and woke up our daughters Emily aged 10 and Rebecca age 14, Katrina aged 15 was already awake and playing her flute. The first job was to let out our three dogs and one cat while putting out their food. Tim left the house at 7.15 am, then I prepared breakfast of apple juice, cereals with milk and tea. Whilst the girls ate their breakfast I prepared chicken soup for the evening meal. At 8.30 am the girls left for school and I tidied the house, before leaving for Caistor Yarborough School where I am a part-time English teacher. During the hour's lunch break I did some shopping and returned to school for a meal of cheese and salad.(Continued page 19)
